item.title: Docker Development Environments
item.description: Very quick set of ugly commands to grab build environments. A much better approach is to make a custom Dockerfile or even better, use nix. However it does work in a pinch. 1docker pull IMG:TAG 2sudo docker run -v LOCALDIR:DIRINDOCKER -it debian:experimental-20211115 bash 3# Don't be root for long 4apt update 5apt install sudo vim zsh 6# Use the same username --> easier to manage permissions 7useradd -m -s /bin/zsh $USER -G sudo 8passwd $USER # Some crap 9# Or just add to the sudoers file 10echo "$USER ALL=(ALL:ALL) ALL" >> /etc/sudoers 11su $USER 12# numpy stuff 13sudo apt install gcc gfortran libopenblas-dev python3.
